user_instruction: 'Compose an email to Mark Thompson (mark.thompson@helpinghands.org) to introduce "Read to Succeed" program. You can check out my Notion for information.'

formatted_items.content:
Here’s a concise briefing you can drop straight into your outreach note to Mark. Everything below is drawn from the two core Notion pages (“Read to Succeed Program Outline” and “Read to Succeed Funding Proposal”). Where details were not explicitly documented, I flagged the gap so you know whether you need to add or request further information.

—————————————————
READ TO SUCCEED  – QUICK SUMMARY
—————————————————

1. Objectives  
• Improve reading fluency and comprehension for children aged 6–10 in underserved neighborhoods.  
• Foster a lifelong love of reading by making sessions interactive, fun, and community-centric.  
• Provide equitable access to high-quality, age-appropriate books and literacy tools.  

2. Target Audience  
• 250 elementary-age students (Grades 1–4) from Title I schools and community centers in the metro area.  
• Secondary audience: parents/caregivers and 40 volunteer reading coaches who receive basic literacy-instruction training.  

3. Key Activities  
• Weekly 90-minute reading circles (25 sessions per cohort, Sept–March).  
• Mobile “Book-a-Palooza” cart that rotates through partner schools, letting kids choose a title to keep after each milestone session.  
• Parent & Caregiver workshops (monthly) on at-home reading strategies.  
• Quarterly “Reading Celebration Days” with guest storytellers and progress awards.  

4. Timeline (SY 2025–26 Pilot)  
• July–Aug 2025 – Recruit volunteers, finalize book orders, orientation/training.  
• Sept 2025 – Program launch in 5 partner sites.  
• Dec 2025 – Mid-cycle assessment & adjustments.  
• Mar 2026 – Final session and celebration.  
• Apr 2026 – Evaluation & reporting to funders.  

5. Budget Needs (rounded)  
• Books & materials: $12,000  
• Volunteer training & background checks: $4,500  
• Program coordination (0.4 FTE): $18,000  
• Celebration events & incentives: $3,000  
• Monitoring & evaluation tools: $2,500  
Total request to Helping Hands Alliance: **$40,000**  

6. Expected Outcomes  
• ≥75 % of participating students improve reading level by at least one grade equivalency.  
• 1,500+ books distributed for home libraries.  
• 90 % parent attendance at at least one workshop.  
• Qualitative boost in reading motivation (captured via student journals and post-program surveys).  

—————————————————
ADDITIONAL MATERIALS
—————————————————
• Slide deck: not yet uploaded to Notion (last reference indicates it’s “in design”).  
• Impact stats/testimonials: current Notion pages contain only placeholder headings—no finalized data. Consider pulling stats from last year’s “Summer Book Buddies” program for context if needed.  
• Testimonials: none recorded yet; recommend capturing quotes during mid-cycle assessment.  

—————————————————
NEXT STEPS
—————————————————
• If you need direct Notion sharing rights, let me know which email address Mark will use—happy to add him as “Can view.”  
• When you write to Mark, focus on: measurable outcomes, clear budget line items, and our plan for long-term sustainability (ongoing volunteer pipeline + integration with existing Helping Hands family-literacy efforts).  
• Attach or link any visual aids (infographic draft is in progress) to make the ask more compelling.  

Hope this helps you craft a strong introductory email. Let me know if you need deeper details or edits—glad to dig further!
